--- title: "Ibis Birdbrain" description: "the portable Python AI-powered data bot" repo-actions: false code-annotations: hover format: html: toc: false about: id: about template: jolla image: images/brians.png links: - icon: info-circle href: why.qmd - icon: download href: install.qmd - icon: book href: tutorials/getting-started.qmd - icon: github text: GitHub href: https://github.com/ibis-project/ibis-birdbrain - icon: slack href: https://ibis-project.zulipchat.com text: Chat - icon: rss text: RSS href: https://ibis-project.org/posts.xml --- ::: {#about} ::: ::: {.callout-warning} Ibis Birdbrain is currently under construction by slow humans and is highly experimental. Please check back soon! :::
Show demo
### ::: {#collapseDemo .collapse .multi-collapse} ## Demo To get started... ::: {#642ee657 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} from ibis_birdbrain.bots.birdbrain import bot bot("who're you and what can you do?") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html} 
birdbrain:
``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html} 
Hello! I'm birdbrain, created by the Ibis developers. I'm here to assist data practitioners with their projects 
involving Ibis, AI, and many other data tools. 

Here's what I can do for you:

- I can access a data platform via Ibis and run SQL queries.
- Generate and run Python code.
- Search the internet for the information you need.
- Summarize information, whether it's from a webpage or a text document.
- Translate text between languages.
- Offer guidance based on examples in the filesystem.

If you want to know more about the tools I use, you can check out the documentation for Ibis [1] and Marvin [2], or
see the source code for these projects on Github [3][4]. You can also see my own source code [5].

As a little bonus, I know the answer to life, the universe, and everything is 42. 

[1] https://www.ibis-project.org
[2] https://www.askmarvin.ai/components/overview
[3] https://github.com/ibis-project/ibis
[4] https://github.com/prefectHQ/marvin
[5] https://github.com/ibis-project/ibis-birdbrain
``` ::: ::: ::: {#91ae8a30 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} bot("what's the meaning of life?") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html} 
birdbrain:
``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html} 
The meaning of life, the universe, and everything according to "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy" by Douglas 
Adams is 42.
``` ::: ::: :::
